info.name: map-cache - Comprehensive Examples
info.description: Comprehensive examples demonstrating map-cache capabilities including Redis workflow replacements, advanced patterns, and new features

item.name: 1. Getting Started
item.description: Basic operations to get familiar with map-cache

request.description: Create a new cache instance
Store simple key-value pairs
Store nested JSON structures
Access nested values using path notation
Increment a numeric value and return the new value
Replace an existing value
Delete a key and return its value
Delete multiple keys matching a pattern
Setup: Create score and level keys for IF example
Execute commands conditionally based on expressions. Run 'IF - Setup Data' first.
Setup: Create users with scores for FOR example
Loop over all matching keys with wildcard patterns. Run 'FOR - Setup Data' first.
Return computed values with string interpolation
Setup: Create data for optional values examples
Returns false because user/premium doesn't exist. Syntax: key || literal_value. Run 'Optional Values - Setup Examples' first.
Returns \"Guest\" (with quotes in JSON, they're stripped). For string literals, use quotes. Run 'Optional Values - Setup Examples' first.
Returns \"light\" from defaults/theme. Unquoted strings work too. Run 'Optional Values - Setup Examples' first.
Returns 100 because user/quota doesn't exist. Numbers, floats, booleans work as defaults. Run 'Optional Values - Setup Examples' first.
Returns 123 from user/id (ignores default 0). When key exists, its value is returned. Run 'Optional Values - Setup Examples' first.
Setup: Create partial user settings (only theme exists, notifications and maxItems missing)
⚠️ This does NOT work - interpolation doesn't happen in object values. The || syntax only works when RETURN's key is a string, not an object.
Optional values work for single string returns. Run 'Optional Values - With Defaults (Setup)' first.
Limitation: The || syntax only works in RETURN's key when it's a string. For objects, build them with literal values or existing keys.
Complex expressions are automatically cached (19-76% faster). Run 'FOR - Setup Data' from Command System section first.

item.name: 4. Redis Replacements
item.description: Common Redis patterns implemented with map-cache

request.description: Initialize rate limiting data structure
Check rate limit and increment if allowed (replaces Redis INCR with TTL)
Store session data (replaces Redis HSET)
Update session last active timestamp
Initialize shopping cart
Increment item quantity in cart
Remove item from cart and return remaining items
Setup leaderboard with player scores
Update player score and return all scores (replaces Redis ZINCRBY)
Setup multiple counters
Atomically increment multiple counters
Setup job queue with multiple jobs
Trigger that auto-completes jobs when progress reaches total
Cascade trigger - marks queue complete when all jobs are done
Update progress - triggers will auto-update status when complete
Setup countdown pattern with multiple domains
When countdown reaches 0, mark domain as complete
When all domains complete, mark overall status as complete
Decrement all countdowns at once - triggers cascade automatically
Log all events matching pattern (pub/sub with triggers)
Setup multi-tenant data structure
Get active status for all users across all tenants
Bulk update quotas based on user role
Deactivate a specific user

item.name: Multi-tenant - Count Active Users Per Tenant

request.description: Get active users for each tenant (arrays can be counted in application)
Setup: Create data for wildcard examples
Returns array of all matching values. Run 'Wildcard - Setup Data' first.
Check if ANY matching value meets condition. Run 'Wildcard - Setup Data' first.
Check if ALL matching values meet condition. Run 'Wildcard - Setup Data' first.
Delete all keys matching pattern, returns deleted values. Run 'Wildcard - Setup Data' first.
Use captured segments (${{1}}, ${{2}}) from nested wildcards
Setup: Create data for performance examples
Batch multiple operations in single transaction. Run 'Performance - Setup Data' first.
Same expression used repeatedly - cached for 19-76% performance gain. Run 'Performance - Setup Data' first.
Atomic operation - check stock, decrement, and return in single transaction. Run 'Performance - Setup Data' first.
